climbs.name: Second Thoughts
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Dick Saume, December 1977

content.description: This route is primarily a face climb, although you wouldn't guess this from the ground.  Start up the south buttress of Echo Rock.  Instead of going up the prow as for T.S. Special, move right and around the corner, following a low angle dihedral.  The dihedral soon becomes an ominous looking bombay chimney.  At this point, move right and belay.  Then climb up past three bolts (crux) and then continue up a corner to the top.
content.protection: three bolts plus a standard rack

content.description:
Down and right from the finish of Bambi Meets Godzilla is a hidden corridor which is passed through as part of the descent for that route.

This route climbs past two bolts along a left-slanting dike system on the left (west) wall of the corridor. Gear belay and easy walk off.
The route goes up the steep face just left of Beadwagon.
content.protection: Bolts, although you can get in a piece here and there at the easy climbing down below if you wish.

content.description: Down and right from the finish of Bambi Meets Godzilla is a hidden corridor which is passed through as part of the descent for that route.
content.location: This route climbs the black waterstreak 40 feet left of Mother Trucker.

climbs.name: Hex Marks the Route
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Keith Breuckner, April 1993

content.description:
Begin in the crack system about 40 feet left of Frumunda Cheese and about 40 feet right of Closed on Monday.

Pitch 1: Climb the right of two cracks (5.10-) moving left to a belay ledge.

Pitch 2: Traverse back right, climb the right side of a block (5.10a), and continue up a flared crack through a bulge (5.9). Move up and left and climb a steepening slab past two bolts (5.10c above the first bolt and 5.10d above the second bolt) up to a big ledge (2 to 3-inch gear anchor). Scramble off to the right.

This bolted face route, immediately right of Finger Food, is continuously difficult, tenuous, and interesting climbing for the first 30' after which it eases a bit to more straightforward JT slab work. Stem, palm, crimp and smear your way up the shallow corner until it disappears and a decent face hold and crimpy dike appear. Engineer a sequence to mount these and you can finally rest and compose yourself for the upper half of the pitch.
content.protection: Bolted, but poorly, IMO. If you fall clipping the second bolt, you will deck. Ideally there would be another bolt between 1 and 2, but there isn't and the moves there could well be the crux.  A bold lead for sure considering the insecurity of the climbing. Once the second bolt is clipped, the route is safe enough.  I'd recommend either a stick clip or crashpad unless you are super dialed on 11+ JT friction and stemming.

climbs.name: Gumby Saves Bambi
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger, Andy Brown & Mike Lindsay, 4/87

content.description: I don't think anyone has done this for quite some time.  An oak tree branch has taken over the start and all the bolts appear to be old (they have Leeper hangers but I can't tell what size the bolts are).

This obscure line escaped publication in the Older Vogel books and we found details in the rockshop in the notebook.  The rock is generally imperfect as it has not had much traffic, but is only a little scaley until you get up top to a few crumbles. No big looseys.
content.protection: A moderate rack with pro to 4"
content.location: Just left of Bambi... you will see a long crack system just left of the blunt arete. Climb up this with a corner on your left until you slope up and right out to top out up on the ledge above Bambi.

content.description: Around on the East side of Echo Rock, down low, is a straight, thin, attractive crack. It's real short. This is Finger Food.Vogel's guide says 10a, but really more like 5.8.You can scramble off the back.
content.protection: good pro; put first piece high. Take some big cams for the anchor.

content.description: This climb has a fun roof and thin face above.  It is loose near the start.

climbs.name: Beadwagon
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Dave Evans, and Jim Angione, November 1988

content.description: This is a fun and varied face climb, with one short, steep, strenuous crux down low; some easy, exposed mantles higher; and then a balancy move over an overhang (second crux) onto a large traverse dike.  It is in a shady location. There is good protection on the hard moves, but some long runouts on easy ground.
content.protection: standard rack plus two bolts and a fixed pin
content.location: This route could be considered a direct start to the upper part of Second Thoughts.  Well around to the right from T.S. Special, climb up a dike (the left of two) to get to the upper ramp.

climbs.name: Bambi Meets Godzilla
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Alan Roberts, Al Hoblitt 1975

content.description: This route is on the NE face of Echo Rock and approximately in the middle. It's an obvious, slightly s-curving crack that is quite long. The route begins behind a pine tree. It's rated 5.8, but my partner and I felt the upper portion of the crack was 5.9.
content.protection: Standard rack. Make sure you have your large cams along.
